_metadata.description: Betfair Exchange Stream API Field Definitions

op.description: Identifies the message type for routing processing logic
op.ml_notes: Routing field only - not used in models

pt.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds when Betfair sent the message. CRITICAL: This is NOT persistence type. Essential for latency analysis, time-series ordering, and calculating time-to-event.
pt.ml_notes: Required for temporal features, time-series modeling, and time-to-off calculations

common_errors.misidentification: Often confused with Persistence Type (L=Lapse, P=Persist, MOC=Market On Close)
common_errors.validation: Value should be 13-digit number representing Unix milliseconds

clk.description: Sequence token for message ordering and recovery. Store this value - if disconnected, supply it with identical subscription criteria to receive delta updates instead of full image.
clk.ml_notes: Infrastructure field for reconnection - not used in models

initialClk.description: Initial sequence token provided at subscription start. Used together with clk for faster recovery after disconnection.

ct.description: Identifies the type of change being delivered

values.SUB_IMAGE: Initial image from subscription - replace local cache entirely
values.RESUB_DELTA: Patch from resubscription - apply as delta
values.HEARTBEAT: Keep-alive message with no data changes
values.null: Standard update - apply as delta to cache

ct.ml_notes: Useful for data quality filtering - filter out HEARTBEAT for training

img.description: If true, replace existing cache with this data (full snapshot). If null/false, apply as delta to existing cache. Critical for correct state reconstruction.
img.ml_notes: Essential for correct feature engineering - must distinguish snapshots from deltas for cache building

con.description: If true, multiple updates were combined in this message due to client buffer delay or conflateMs setting. Important for understanding data granularity and potential information loss.
con.ml_notes: Indicates potential data quality issues - consider filtering con=true for high-frequency models

status.description: Stream health indicator. Null when data is up-to-date, 503 when experiencing latency issues.

values.null: Stream data is current and reliable
values.503: Stream data may be delayed or incomplete

status.ml_notes: Filter out status=503 records for reliable training data

segmentType.description: Identifies multi-part segmented messages for large payloads

mc.description: Array of MarketChange objects containing changes for subscribed markets. Each element represents updates for a single market.
mc.ml_notes: Access child fields for actual data

id.description: Unique Betfair market identifier. Format: 1.XXXXXXXXX (e.g., 1.122930790). Links all runner data to a specific betting market.
id.ml_notes: Primary key for joining data and grouping by market

tv.description: Total amount matched in GBP. At market level (mc[].tv): total across all runners. At runner level (rc[].tv): total for that selection. Truncated at 2 decimal places.
tv.ml_notes: Key liquidity indicator - useful for volume-weighted features and activity detection

rc.description: Array of RunnerChange objects containing price/volume updates for individual selections. Only runners with changes are included in each update.
rc.ml_notes: Access child fields for order book data

marketDefinition.description: Complete market metadata including venue, status, runners, timing. Sent in full only when changed. Requires EX_MARKET_DEF filter flag in subscription.
marketDefinition.ml_notes: Provides static context features (venue, market type, etc.) - join to streaming data

ltp.description: Most recent matched price on this selection. Key indicator of current market consensus. Only sent if changed.
ltp.ml_notes: Primary target variable and feature for price prediction models

batb.description: Best back prices excluding virtual bets. Array of [level, price, size] triples. Level 0 = best price. Size=0 indicates removal from that level.

structure.level: Integer 0-9, where 0 is best (top of book)
structure.size: Available volume in GBP at this level

batb.ml_notes: Essential for order book features - spread calculation, depth analysis, imbalance detection

batl.description: Best lay prices excluding virtual bets. Array of [level, price, size] triples. Mirrors batb structure for lay side.

structure.level: Integer 0-9, where 0 is best (top of book)
structure.size: Available volume in GBP at this level

batl.ml_notes: Essential for order book features - spread calculation, depth analysis, imbalance detection

bdatb.description: Best back prices INCLUDING virtual bets. Array of [level, price, size] triples. Same structure as batb but includes starting price bets.
bdatb.ml_notes: Alternative to batb when virtual bets are relevant

bdatl.description: Best lay prices INCLUDING virtual bets. Array of [level, price, size] triples. Same structure as batl but includes starting price bets.
bdatl.ml_notes: Alternative to batl when virtual bets are relevant

atb.description: Full depth back ladder. Array of [price, size] tuples at every price with available volume.
atb.ml_notes: Full order book depth - useful for support/resistance analysis

atl.description: Full depth lay ladder. Array of [price, size] tuples at every price with available volume.
atl.ml_notes: Full order book depth - useful for support/resistance analysis

trd.description: Full traded history showing volume matched at each price point. Array of [price, size] tuples.

structure.size: Total volume traded at this price

trd.ml_notes: Essential for VWAP calculation and volume-at-price analysis

spn.description: Betfair Starting Price near projection. Updated as market approaches start time. Lower bound of BSP estimate.
spn.ml_notes: BSP prediction target - near/far spread indicates confidence

spf.description: Betfair Starting Price far projection. Upper bound of BSP estimate. Narrows as race approaches.
spf.ml_notes: BSP prediction target - combined with spn provides confidence range

spb.description: Starting price back ladder. Array of [price, size] tuples for SP back orders.

spl.description: Starting price lay ladder. Array of [price, size] tuples for SP lay orders.

venue.description: Racing venue name (e.g., 'Cheltenham', 'Southwell', 'Kempton'). Horse racing and greyhound markets only.
venue.ml_notes: Important categorical feature - patterns vary significantly by venue

marketType.description: Market type code identifying the bet type

values.WIN: Win market - bet on the winner
values.PLACE: Place market - bet on placed finishers

marketType.ml_notes: Filter for WIN markets for initial model development

marketTime.description: Scheduled race start time in ISO 8601 format. Critical for calculating time-to-off feature.
marketTime.ml_notes: Essential for time-to-off calculation: marketTime - pt

inPlay.description: Boolean indicating if market is currently in-play (race in progress). Critical for strategy switching between pre-race and in-play models.
inPlay.ml_notes: Segmentation feature - pre-race and in-play require different models

numberOfActiveRunners.description: Count of selections currently available for betting. Changes when runners are withdrawn (non-runners).
numberOfActiveRunners.ml_notes: Field size affects market dynamics - important feature

numberOfWinners.description: Number of winning places in this market (1 for WIN markets, 2-4 for place markets).

eventId.description: Groups related markets (e.g., all markets for same race - WIN, PLACE, etc.). Essential for cross-market analysis.

eventTypeId.description: Sport/event type identifier. Used to filter for specific sports.
eventTypeId.ml_notes: Filter for sport-specific analysis - 7 for horse racing

countryCode.description: ISO country code for the event location (e.g., 'GB', 'IE', 'AU').

status.ml_notes: Filter for OPEN status for training data

betDelay.description: Seconds delay applied to in-play bets. Typically 0 pre-race, increases during in-play.

bspMarket.description: Whether this market supports Betfair Starting Price.

bspReconciled.description: Whether BSP has been calculated and reconciled for this market.

turnInPlayEnabled.description: Whether this market will turn in-play when the event starts.

persistenceEnabled.description: Whether orders can persist into in-play.

discountAllowed.description: Whether commission discounts apply to this market.

complete.description: Whether the market is complete (all bets settled).

crossMatching.description: Whether cross matching is enabled for this market.

runnersVoidable.description: Whether runner removal could void bets.

marketBaseRate.description: Base commission rate for this market (typically 5%). Required for profit calculations after commission.

eachWayDivisor.description: Fraction of win odds for place portion (e.g., 4.0 = 1/4 odds). Only for EACH_WAY markets.

openDate.description: Date/time when market opened for betting. ISO 8601 format.

settledTime.description: Date/time when market was settled. ISO 8601 format. Only populated after settlement.
settledTime.ml_notes: Useful for calculating total market duration

suspendTime.description: Date/time when market was suspended. ISO 8601 format.

regulators.description: List of regulatory bodies overseeing this market.

version.description: Non-monotonic version number. Higher = more recent. Used to identify latest version if duplicates received.

name.description: Descriptive name of the market (e.g., '2m4f Grd1 Hrd', 'Each Way'). NOT the runner name.
name.ml_notes: Display field - contains race distance/type info that could be parsed

common_errors.misidentification: Often confused with runner name - this is the MARKET name

runners.description: Array of RunnerDefinition objects with metadata for each selection in the market.

runners[].id.description: Unique identifier for the runner/selection. Same as rc[].id. Join key between runner definition and price updates.

runners[].name.ml_notes: Display only - could be used for NLP features or name-based analysis

runners[].sortPriority.description: Display order on Betfair website. Lower number = higher display position (typically by price/favoritism).

runners[].status.ml_notes: Filter for ACTIVE runners in training

runners[].adjustmentFactor.description: Reduction factor applied if runner is removed (Rule 4 deductions). Higher = more fancied. Sum of all active runners' adjustmentFactors approaches 100.
runners[].adjustmentFactor.ml_notes: Represents implied probability from Betfair - useful as feature or label

runners[].bsp.description: Final calculated Betfair Starting Price. Only populated after BSP reconciliation.
runners[].bsp.ml_notes: Ground truth for BSP prediction models

runners[].removalDate.description: Date/time when runner was removed (if applicable). ISO 8601 format.
runners[].removalDate.ml_notes: For handling non-runners in historical analysis

runners[].hc.description: Handicap value for the runner. Null if not applicable (most horse racing markets).

rc[].id.description: Unique numeric identifier for the runner/selection in price update context. Links to runners[].id.
